description: Tools for software developers - CLIs, IDEs, testing, deployment

examples.title: Linear-style Issue Tracker for Solo Devs

facets.audience: Solo developers and small teams (1-5) who find Jira overkill
facets.jtbd: Track work without context-switching - keyboard-first, git-integrated, local-first
facets.differentiator: Stores issues in git repo as markdown, syncs with commits automatically
facets.monetization: Free CLI, $8/mo for cloud sync and team features
facets.distribution: Dev Twitter, HN Show, integration with popular dotfiles

examples.why_good: Clear niche (solo devs), solves real pain (Jira overhead), unique angle (git-native), viable monetization path
examples.score_rationale: High feasibility (CLI is straightforward), good differentiation (git-native is unique), moderate market (solo devs is niche but passionate)

examples.title: AI-Powered Changelog Generator from Git History

facets.audience: Open source maintainers and dev teams shipping weekly releases
facets.jtbd: Generate human-readable changelogs from commit messages without manual curation
facets.differentiator: Groups commits by semantic impact, links PRs/issues, suggests version bumps
facets.monetization: Free for public repos, $12/mo for private repos with CI integration
facets.distribution: GitHub Marketplace, sponsor badges on popular OSS projects

examples.why_good: Clear problem (changelog is tedious), specific audience (OSS maintainers), natural distribution (GitHub ecosystem)
examples.score_rationale: Very feasible (LLM + git parsing), fast value (works on first run), but low differentiation (many changelog tools exist)
